pr_title: Fixing formatting issues and making content clearly

timeline.message: Fixing formatting issues and make content clearly

timeline.bodyText: Where do we guide to follow the next steps of step 2 -(5) of "Upgrading API-M from 2.6.0 to 3.1.0" doc ? I guess it should be either at the end of this page.
timeline.author: rmsamitha
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -12,43 +12,42 @@ The following information describes how to upgrade your **WSO2 API Manager (WSO2
 
     -   If you wish to upgrade your APIM environment from **API-M 2.6.0 to 3.1.0** , which is using the **internal** WSO2 Identity Server (**WSO2 IS**) **capabilities** , follow the instructions in [Upgrading API-M from 2.6.0 to 3.1.0](../upgrading-wso2-api-manager/upgrading-from-260-to-310.md).
 
-Upgrade WSO2 API-M **from WSO2 API-M 2.6.0 to 3.1.0** when using **WSO2 IS** as the **Key Manager:** as mentioned in below.
+When **WSO2 Identity Server (WSO2 IS)** is the **Key Manager**,
 
-Follow the instructions mentioned in [Upgrading API-M from 2.6.0 to 3.1.0](../upgrading-wso2-api-manager/upgrading-from-260-to-310.md), 
-but **instead of step 2 - (5)**, which explains how to migrate the WSO2 API-M Identity components, 
-follow the WSO2 Identity Server 5.10.0 documentation to migrate the WSO2 Identity Server (WSO2 IS) from version 5.7.0 to 5.10.0.
-[Migrate the WSO2 Identity Server (WSO2 IS) from version 5.7.0 to 5.10.0](https://is.docs.wso2.com/en/5.10.0/setup/migrating-to-5100/)
+Follow the instructions in [Upgrading API-M from 2.6.0 to 3.1.0](../upgrading-wso2-api-manager/upgrading-from-260-to-310.md),
+**instead of step 2 - (5)**, which explains how to migrate the WSO2 API-M Identity components,

replies.bodyText: This is page is something like alteration of step 2 -(5) of "Upgrading API-M from 2.6.0 to 3.1.0" doc. So that order should be mentioned clearly
replies.author: rmsamitha

replies.bodyText:
You mean like

follow the  "Upgrading API-M from 2.6.0 to 3.1.0" doc up to step 2  - (4)
follow the IS migration doc
follow the  "Upgrading API-M from 2.6.0 to 3.1.0" doc starting step 2 - (6)
Is that?
replies.author: HiranyaKavishani

timeline.bodyText: "Don't follow this step if u are using IS-AS-KM" ==> this idea is not conveyed. Isn't it?
timeline.author: rmsamitha
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -2002,7 +1999,9 @@ Follow the instructions below to move all the existing API Manager configuration
 6.  Upgrade the Identity component in WSO2 API Manager from version 5.2.0 to 5.10.0.
 
     !!! note
-        As WSO2 API-M shares identity components with WSO2 Identity Sever (WSO2 IS), this step is necessary to upgrade those components (even if you are not using WSO2 IS as a Key Manager).
+        If you are using WSO2 Identity Server (WSO2 IS) as a Key Manager, follow the instructions in [Upgrading WSO2 IS as the Key Manager to 5.10.0](../upgrading-wso2-is-as-key-manager/upgrading-from-is-km-520-to-5100.md).
+

timeline.bodyText: "Even" is not needed right? "if you are not using WSO2 IS as a Key Manager" then you must flow the below setps.
timeline.author: rmsamitha
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -2002,7 +1999,9 @@ Follow the instructions below to move all the existing API Manager configuration
 6.  Upgrade the Identity component in WSO2 API Manager from version 5.2.0 to 5.10.0.
 
     !!! note
-        As WSO2 API-M shares identity components with WSO2 Identity Sever (WSO2 IS), this step is necessary to upgrade those components (even if you are not using WSO2 IS as a Key Manager).
+        If you are using WSO2 Identity Server (WSO2 IS) as a Key Manager, follow the instructions in [Upgrading WSO2 IS as the Key Manager to 5.10.0](../upgrading-wso2-is-as-key-manager/upgrading-from-is-km-520-to-5100.md).
+
+        Even if you are not using WSO2 IS as a Key Manager, following steps are necessary to be followed in order to upgrade identity components as WSO2 API-M shares the identity components with WSO2 Identity Sever (WSO2 IS).

timeline.bodyText: We don't follow the whole steps in "Upgrading API-M from 2.0.0 to 3.1.0" before these steps right?
timeline.author: rmsamitha
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -10,60 +10,53 @@ The following information describes how to upgrade your **WSO2 API Manager (WSO2
         -   You are currently using a WSO2 IS 5.2.0 vanilla distribution that has WSO2 API Management related Key Manager features installed on top of it.
         -   You are currently using a pre-packaged WSO2 Identity Server 5.2.0 distribution.
 
-    -   If you wish to upgrade your APIM environment from **API-M 2.0.0 to 3.1.0**, which is using the **internal** WSO2 Identity Server (**WSO2 IS**) **capabilities**, follow the instructions in [Upgrading API-M from 2.0.0 to 3.1.0](../upgrading-wso2-api-manager/upgrading-from-200-to-310.md).
+    -   In prior to upgrade the **WSO2 Identity Server (WSO2 IS) AS Key Manager**, you have to upgrade your APIM environment from **API-M 2.0.0 to 3.1.0** as described in [Upgrading API-M from 2.0.0 to 3.1.0](../upgrading-wso2-api-manager/upgrading-from-200-to-310.md).

replies.bodyText: This has been added if someone 1st come to this page and do the identity component migration first, they can be faced an issue during migration as they missed to execute the DB scripts related to AM table.
replies.author: HiranyaKavishani

replies.bodyText: What about this.  "Prior to upgrading the WSO2 Identity Server (WSO2 IS) AS Key Manager, you have to follow the required steps to upgrade your APIM environment from API-M 2.0.0 to 3.1.0 as described in Upgrading API-M from 2.0.0 to 3.1.0.
replies.author: rmsamitha

replies.bodyText: "Prior to upgrading the WSO2 Identity Server (WSO2 IS) AS Key Manager, you have to follow the steps mentioned in "Upgrading API-M from 2.0.0 to 3.1.0." guide, to upgrade your APIM environment from API-M 2.0.0 to 3.1.0.
replies.author: rmsamitha
